alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 9:44AM PST until December 08 at 9:31PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Thurston and Grays Harbor Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain is over but flood waters continue to make their way down rivers and streams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chehalis River at Porter. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 47.6 feet. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 48.7 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1045 AM PST.
